_comment: This file contains the search rules for the search engine

rules_search.description: Use AND, OR, NOT to combine search terms. For example, term1 AND term2.

Use * to replace any number of characters. For example, comput* will return computer, computing, computation, etc. Use ? to replace a single character. For example, decentrali?ed will return decentralized and decentralised.
Use quotation marks to search for an exact phrase. For example, "decentralized oracles" will return only results that contain this exact phrase.

Use parentheses to group search terms. For example, (decentralized oracles) AND (blockchain) will return results that contain the word blockchain and either decentralized oracles or decentralized oracles.
Use field search to search for terms in specific fields. For example, author:Smith will return results that contain the word Smith in the author field.
